channel.title: I'm on linux. I want to play rsc servers
channel.description: Title basically tells you everything. I want to play rsc servers. I need run.sh for the client. Thanks.

item.title: I'm on linux. I want to play rsc servers
item.dc:creator: @pklobbys pklobbys
item.description:
@pklobbys wrote:

Thanks. i got it working. I’m running RSCLEGENDS bot right now
Anyways. Now I have the urge to host my rsc server. Any suggestions on where I can get JDK? other then a simple half assed www.java.com? I need the command to install it… I followed the guide which failed. I need a little help

Btw, i got rsbot working. Macroing on rs2 and a rsc server. Ubuntu is durable.

item.title: I'm on linux. I want to play rsc servers
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

You wouldn’t need root privs if you created the file as the current user. “chmod +x file” makes a file executable

item.source: I'm on linux. I want to play rsc servers

item.title: I'm on linux. I want to play rsc servers
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Do there steps.

  1. Open up your client and see what the name of you jar file is. eg- mine says rscd.jar

  1. Next make a new text document with the same name as your jar file

  1. Next open it and type all this in
java -cp rscd.jar:conf/lib/xstream.jar:conf/lib/xpp3.jar org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient settings.ini

make sure your name of your jar folder is the same as the one you have

2hzh0nl.jpg1005×164

  1. Save it and re-name the .xml file to a .sh file

and your done!! hope this helps,

Read full topic

item.title: I'm on linux. I want to play rsc servers
item.dc:creator: @BuyMyJunk BuyMyJunk
item.description:
@BuyMyJunk wrote:

use the search, or use google

[quote=“KO9, post:11, topic:224260”]Yup, like I said. If you know how to use the operating system it wouldn’t be hard… You’re gonna have real trouble running a server on there if you don’t even know how to use the OS tbh…
That is the unix equivilent to a batch file. But seriously, use windows if you don’t know what you’re doing.[/quote]
